and you'll have time to spend

the world of Bakken,

is Southwest Minnesota State

 about what started you writing

1191.39.text: - I have liked them ever since

1194.13.text:
I read my first Hardy Boys   
   books in the second grade.

And it's the covers were always 
these two guys in danger.

1205.07.text:
that was about to

1207.81.text:
and I just had to

1214.85.text: would be titles that had blood

1222.62.text:
And it was just something    
   that I kept as I grew up.

1226.83.text:
I always loved reading     
     hard crime novels.

1229.86.text: It was just an escape, I think.

1231.86.text:
I'm also kind of a

1239.77.text:
without the fear of

your books don't necessarily

so I know that

1259.29.text: if she doesn't like the ending,

1261.73.text:
'cause there's not

1265.96.text:
There's usually some

1276.24.text:
in a worse place

1285.12.text:
that many people might not have 
wanted to write home about.

They may have glossed

So why tell that

1296.96.text:
- It's the side that I think   
 you see in a lot of newspapers

1301.53.text:
and if you look around,     
    you'll find info about

1305.17.text:
the strip clubs and how     
    Williston, North Dakota,

1309.77.text:
became the stripper capital    
 of the world for a short while

1315.75.text:
with dancers who would

1321.15.text:
I think they closed a

1323.22.text:
but for awhile, it       
       was just a place

1325.42.text:
where if you had a       
       lot of men there,

1327.33.text:
you ended up having crime,

1333.63.text:
with men treating

1338.74.text:
And that's just the

1344.08.text:
and there's a lot

1345.64.text:
But it happened so fast, all

1348.85.text:
on them, too, and they really  
 didn't know how to handle it.

1357.36.text:

1361.39.text:
basically the saloons

is what you're writing

- Yeah, any boom town just   
   seems to have the same

1375.47.text:
What's funny about

1377.28.text:
is that they say those      
    who don't know history,

and we're always doomed

1395.43.text:

1405.57.text: Dennis Lang gave to a question.

They said, "How much

1414.08.text:
If I don't think I know     
    a place well enough,

1416.65.text:
even places I haven't been,   
  'cause there's only been two

1419.25.text:
that I've written about where  
 I just haven't been there.

1421.79.text:
If I didn't think I could    
   do it I wouldn't write it.

1426.76.text:
and someone's gonna

1428.86.text:
So, like, for example, I       
 couldn't go out to the Bakken,

1433.43.text:
unfortunately, but my character 
is from Mobile, Alabama,

1439.07.text:
which I know, because I'm     
  originally from Mississippi,

1442.04.text:
and I know that area      
      of the Gulf coast.

1447.41.text:
the research I did,          
   because when someone said,

1451.42.text:
think about writing       
      about the Bakken,

1453.35.text:
for me, the best research

1457.62.text:
of guys working out there    
   just pouring their hearts

1461.19.text:
into these videos          
     telling other people,

1464.30.text:
if you're gonna come,         
  here's what you gotta know,

1466.50.text:
here's the reality       
       of the situation,

1468.77.text:
or truckers who were taping   
  this at four in the morning,

1471.64.text:
on the road, showing      
      you what it's like.

1473.84.text: So, that was the moment I knew

1477.48.text:
after watching a few      
      hours of those guys,

1479.48.text:
that I could write it,     
     I could try to emulate

1488.59.text:
and the answer to usually    
   write what you know,

1491.22.text:
'cause my problem with a    
    lot of literary fiction

1493.66.text: is that it's all about writers.

1497.33.text:
and I just can't imagine,    
   since I do write,

1503.94.text:
So my thing is, in        
      that case, no more.

1507.20.text:
Go find out about things     
   that you don't know about,

1511.88.text:
rather than just always        
 writing about the same things

1516.18.text:
in the sort of limited       
   pot of soup that you have.

I'm not sure if there'll

Some of my favorite

like our own John            
   Sanford, James Lee Burke,

1554.15.text:
I just read a ton

1558.36.text:
So I've always looked for    
   a character or characters

1562.09.text:
that could I could tell     
    more stories about.

1565.80.text: I wanted to see the stretch,

1568.23.text:
I wanted to see           
      their lives change,

1570.24.text:
and not just be a one      
     and done situation

I've written a few books about 
 a guy named Billy Lafitte

1578.21.text:
And then when it came      
     time for Woman on Ice,

1581.25.text:
I was really looking

1587.25.text:
And this guy, Manny,      
      the former cop,

who, I'm not sure how much

1592.99.text:
but took awhile to just stay  
  and finally became someone

1600.80.text:
strong urge to tell       
      this story with.

Manny was not originally    
    in my head, transsexual,

1610.88.text:
the story came about,      
     it just made sense.

1615.05.text:
I don't want to

1616.18.text: but there was a farm accident

1618.38.text:
that might not have       
      been so accidental,

1622.69.text:
with his identity        
       for a long time.

1625.06.text:
Now, I don't know        
       tons about that,

1628.19.text:
but it always comes        
     to me in a character.

1631.40.text:
If a character just          
   sparks and is interesting,

1633.67.text:
then I'll go learn       
       about, you know,

1637.33.text:
So I'm a straight white      
   guy, but I'm a LGBT ally,

1641.21.text:
and so it's really just       
  trying to get into the skin

1644.14.text:
of someone who's not like you, 
 I think is part of the job

1646.78.text:
of being a writer,

I said again, if I didn't      
 think I could've done it well,

and at the same

1660.73.text:
of just getting it

        taking the risk.

And you know, as I journey   
   through books with Manny,

1675.87.text:
even though she            
     keeps the name Manny.

She becomes, you         
       know, a woman, and

I get to see that
